oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Organic Plant Breeding: Achievements, Opportunities, and Challenges
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Horneburg, Bernd
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
Values, standards and certification
Biodiversity and ecosystem services
Breeding, genetics and propagation
Crop health, quality, protection
Weed management
Regulation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The objective of this article is to highlight some successful approaches to organic plant breeding and to encourage the organic movement to engage in an increasing number of organic breeding and organic breeding research projects.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Horneburg, Bernd (2011) Organic Plant Breeding: Achievements, Opportunities, and Challenges. 17th IFOAM Organic World Congress 2011 (OWC), Organic is Life, Namyangju City, Gyeonggi Province, Republic of Korea, September 26 to October 5, 2011. [Completed]
